column4: how about pulling it out and re inserting it, also, since its a USB device, it may be a power setting that you can tweak in your bios.
i did remove and insert the WUSB and the power light won't come on or device not even get detected.
check bios settings
what should i be looking for?
anything USB bus and or power related
my keyboard and mouse are USB. the WirelessUSB card is the only one with issues. do you still feel i should check bios?
are you on a laptop?
desktop
i'm fairly certain also that i have nothing in bios set to power down for idleness. i like pyaing extra for my juice... jk. but still... "fairly" certain...
oh, well thats not as likely a bios setting but at least you can rule it out by checking
if it sleeps from inactivity, then you could  write a simpke script to ping an address somewhere every few minutes
the way i discovered this problem was downloading large files (WoW, torrents, Pandora)
it craps out on large xfers???
it doesn't crap out, it just quits doing its job. if i stay at the computer doing other things the net stays solid
size doesnt matter either (insert laughter here)
lol
you got me. If possible, Id try a different piece of hardware.

you are correct sir (ma'am?) WUSB devices have a history of fail with linux. but i had it long before i had linux. AND to top that off, i have a micro board and my sound card occupies the one PCI slot :) man i sure know how to pick my hardware!
even another USB dongle may be worth a try
forgive my ignorance. what is a dongle?
loosly termed for anything that sticks out from a USB port.
thank you :)
